channel.title: New language to learn
channel.description:
Ok I'm not entirely sure this is correct spot to post this but...
I was thinking about learning a new programming language and wanted to know which would be the best, difficulty on a scale of 1-10 and if it requires a compiler could you post it?
Also I was wondering if it has any uses, such as would it be worth learning.
Thanks in advanced for your help.

item.title: New language to learn
item.dc:creator: @jason_x jason_x
item.description:
@jason_x wrote:

Well I guess after all of the debates I will try for c++ if and hopefully it doesnt fail I will go for the next best thing.

Read full topic

item.title: New language to learn
item.dc:creator: @Evan1 Evan`
item.description:
@Evan1 wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:2, topic:144420”]I don’t know what you’ve learned in the past, but you could try Visual Basic for a start.[/quote]Visual basic isn’t a programming language it’s just something for people who think they can program to show off.Alot of great things are programmed with c++ try that.

Read full topic

item.title: New language to learn
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“sh!ft, post:63, topic:144420”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=197971.msg1829234#msg1829234 date=1192730428]

Well I guess I will go with c++ even though it gets really hard towards the more advanced scripts jsut stuff I will have to remember.

What language doesn’t?
[/quote]

Java, Pascal, Python, Delphi… I could go on.[/quote]I didn’t see C++ in that list, although you’ve indicated that the end isn’t there

Read full topic

item.title: New language to learn
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“jason_x, post:59, topic:144420”]By engine I mean the graphics engine I have my eyes on its only $150 but It seems useful for what I need it for and I only have two computers set up as servers but they are old as hell.

Well I guess I will go with c++ even though it gets really hard towards the more advanced scripts jsut stuff I will have to remember.[/quote]

Use OpenGL, it is free, cross platform, and an industry standard.

Also C++ is far less complicated than C.

Read full topic

@moparisthebest wrote:

By ‘engine’ what do you mean? For graphics I would use OpenGL (edit: no matter what language you use, you can use OpenGL :))

item.title: New language to learn
item.dc:creator: @jason_x jason_x
item.description:
@jason_x wrote:

Ok yeah but can you find a not so expensive game engine that works with Java because I havent seen one.
Ok I am not trying to belittle java or anything but I want like real good quality with the engine scripts

Read full topic

item.title: New language to learn
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Where did you hear C is the best language for game development at? Certainly it used to be the best language, doom and doom 2 were in C, but now there is new technology and object orientation is a giant step ahead in programming. C++ is probably the most used language for writing games currently, also Java is gaining speed fast, there have already been some good games written in Java.

Read full topic

item.title: New language to learn
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

KryptoN_:

[quote=Mujahed]I recommened going into c++ its farely simple and i found it easier than java. but thats only at the basics, variables if statements and crap like that.

C++ and Java are basically the same for the basics… the main difference with shit like Hello, world! is that instead of “cout” you have “System.out.println”. After that, imo C++ gets a lot harder, as you need to take care of pointers n shit, whereas Java hides that.

Btw, I’m sure there are plenty of comparison tables on the internet and wikipedia of programming languages.

en.wikipedia.org

Comparison of programming languages

Programming languages are used for controlling the behavior of a machine (often a computer). Like natural languages, programming languages conform to rules for syntax and semantics. There are thousands of programming languages and new ones are created every year. Few languages ever become sufficiently popular that they are used by more than a few people, but professional programmers may use dozens of languages in a career. Most programming languages are not standardized by an international (or ...

http://shootout.alioth.debian.org/gp4/benchmark.php?test=all&lang=all

As for ease, I think scripting languages are better for beginners.[/quote]

Your right they are really similar but i find that c++ doesnt confuse you as much. compare

int main(void)

with

public static void main(strng[]args)

A lot less to take in at the start for c++.

Read full topic

item.title: New language to learn
item.dc:creator: @KryptoN KryptoN_
item.description:
@KryptoN wrote:

Why the fuck would you want to learn Brainfuck? It’s bloody less readable than ASM and has no practical use.

On the other hand, Ruby:

[code]def initialize(filename)
tag, @title, @artist, @album, @year, @comment, @genre= get_file_tail(filename, 128).unpack(“A3A30A30A30A4A30C”)
raise “ID3 tags not present!” if tag != ‘TAG’
s_com, flag, track = @comment.unpack(“A28CC”)
if flag == 0 and track != 0
@comment = s_com
@track = track
end
@genre = GENRES[@genre] || “Unknown”
end

def get_file_tail(file, offset)
f = File.new(file)
f.seek(-offset, IO::SEEK_END)
f.read
end[/code]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

KryptoN_:

[quote=Mujahed]I recommened going into c++ its farely simple and i found it easier than java. but thats only at the basics, variables if statements and crap like that.

C++ and Java are basically the same for the basics…[/quote]

But there is one main difference excluding the whole language basics, C++ is more of a low level programming language, while Java is a bit more higher in level.

Read full topic

Few languages ever become sufficiently popular that they are used by more than a few people, but professional programmers may use dozens of languages in a career. Most programming languages are not standardized by an international (or ...

item.title: New language to learn
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

I recommened going into c++ its farely simple and i found it easier than java. but thats only at the basics, variables if statements and crap like that. Java does get confusing but it’s a nice language to learn, especially if you want to h4x0r runescape. Scar is really easy too but its farely limited.

As for curly braces and ends. Curly braces are ALOT more clear than begin-ends. Begin-ends can give you brain cancer.

Read full topic

Lets call it Assembly from now on. ASM = Java related.
[/quote]
Well… it also has a half-dozen other uses that are much more popular.
The meaning is contextually really clear however, seeing how this thread has nothing to do with Java/bytecode.[/quote]True, true. [quote=“killerman93, post:41, topic:144420”]Do a Linux Distro :P[/quote]I think he wants to learn a language
